meanings.definition: To cause intense fear or dread in
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm would terrify the little puppy.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie was so scary, it could terrify anyone.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house was meant to terrify visitors, but it ended up being more funny than scary.
meanings.sent4: The idea of failing the test would terrify her like a monster lurking in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The ghost story was told in such a way that it would terrify even the bravest of souls.

meanings.definition: To fill with terror or anxiety
meanings.sent1: The thought of speaking in front of a large crowd would terrify him.
meanings.sent2: The news of the approaching storm began to terrify the residents of the small town.
meanings.sent3: The idea of running out of ice cream would terrify any child.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the night seemed to terrify the young child, making every shadow look like a monster.
meanings.sent5: The uncertainty of the future can terrify even the most confident individuals.
